msContents.summary: Receipt for payment of rent of date palms, or a tax on them.

msItem.note: Text is on one side only, 7 lines written with the fibers. All margins are visible. Text mentions location of Philoteris.

supportDesc.support: 13.3 x 9.5cm. Two fragments, pieced together as though upper and lower shark teeth. A large chunk is missing from the lower left.

origin.persName: Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1898-9) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).

div.ab: The 13th year of the Emperor Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius, the first of the month Hadrianus, for the account of Athur. Paid by...son of Heron, lessee of Ptolemaeus, son of Cronius, for the rent of date palms...at Philoteris on account of the Antonian estate for the 12th year one hundred and sixty (drachmae of silver), total 160; for the receipt, 3 obols. (Grenfell, Hunt & Hogarth)

listBibl.bibl: P. Fay. 60 John R. Abercrombie, "The University Museum's Collection of Papyri and Related Materials," Expedition 20.2 (Winter 1978): 32-37.
